bibl.title: Memorandum from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, October 1, 1928

div1.p: This memorandum functions as an appendix to references Carter has previously sent to Frost.

div1.head: Memorandum from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, October 1, 1928
div1.p:
Mem. (For Dr. Wade H. Frost)
October 1, 1928.

After all I did leave out two essentials in my letter of last
night re the material herein enclosed:

A: (4)-d: Re Nott, J. C. (Page 2 my letter) I should have stated
that attached to page 23 of [unclear] Section 1, Epidemiology, which I was
sending you, you would find the verbatim quotations from Nott (re
the epidemics of 1842 & '43 and that of 1853) which were needed to make
this page (23-Father's MSS) absolutely accurate.

B: That in this registered envelope you will also receive the
Preface to Father's work.

P. S. Re title Father's book etc. I am also enclosing carbon of a
letter I wrote you from Dunlora in July 1927: The only part of which
that is relevant to the above being on p. 2 of the letter (D) and (E).

To go back to the title, had one better stress the early history
or the probable place of origin of y. f? This, of course, is a matter
of the “group psychology” of the people to whom such a book will appeal,
and you are far more conversant with their particular “Psyche” than I.
